segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
4. Overflowing Merit
39. With Kāḷigodhā

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena kāḷigodhāya sākiyāniyā nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Kāḷigodhā the Sakyan lady, where he sat on the seat spread out.

segments.pli: Atha kho kāḷigodhā sākiyānī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho kāḷigodhaṃ sākiyāniṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Kāḷigodhā went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to her:

segments.pli: “Catūhi kho, godhe, dhammehi samannāgatā ariyasāvikā sotāpannā hoti avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā.
segments.en: “Godhā, a female noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
What four?

segments.pli: Idha, godhe, ariyasāvikā buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatā hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgā payatapāṇinī vossaggaratā yācayogā dānasaṃvibhāgaratā.
segments.en: And they live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, godhe, catūhi dhammehi samannāgatā ariyasāvikā sotāpannā hoti avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā”ti.
segments.en: A female noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”

segments.pli: “Yānimāni, bhante, bhagavatā cattāri sotāpattiyaṅgāni desitāni, saṃvijjante dhammā mayi, ahañca tesu dhammesu sandissāmi.
segments.en: “Sir, these four factors of stream-entry that were taught by the Buddha are found in me, and I am seen in them.
For I have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: yaṃ kho pana kiñci kule deyyadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ appaṭivibhattaṃ sīlavantehi kalyāṇadhammehī”ti.
segments.en: And I share without reservation all the gifts available to give in our family with those who are ethical and of good character.”
“You’re fortunate, Godhā, so very fortunate,
You have declared the fruit of stream-entry.”
